dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss. We're not from around here. Can you tell us how to get to Benny's Cafe?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I sure can. Where you visitin' from?

dialogues.speaker: LOST WIFE
dialogues.text: Minnesota.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Well, welcome to Savannah! Glad to have you.  58.

dialogues.speaker: LOST WIFE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Very much. We're so glad to -- Harold, put that map away for God's sake! Can't you see this nice woman is trying to help us? He puts it away, smiles condescendingly at Delilah.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Benny's is sooo good. You have got to try their oysters. They are ab- so-lute-ly out o' this world.

dialogues.speaker: LOST HUSBAND
dialogues.text: We would ab-so-lute-ly like to try them. Sooner rather than later.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Well, that's easy. You head straight down River Street, take a sharp left on Bay by Cromwell Theatre. That's where they had that awful fire twelve years back. Oh, and it was such a shame, too, cuz at that time it was the oldest theatre in all o' Georgia. They redid it nice 'n pretty, but it's just not the same. When you reach the end o' Bay, you wanna turn left onto Matlin and a quick right onto Acorn. You'll see Ernesto's Cafe on the corner. It used to be Henry's Diner, but when Henry's wife caught 'im cheatin' with the hostess, poor man lost everythin'. Benny's is just two more blocks from there. Straight shot, you can't miss it. The Wife seems more ready to have an aneurysm than an oys

dialogues.speaker: LOST WIFE
dialogues.text: Thank you. The Couple turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: LOST HUSBAND
dialogues.text: (takes out the map) Told you. Delilah practices her box step, jabbing as she goes. Nate and Abby turn up. Dad's smiling, daughter's frowning

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hey, Punchy.  59.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: There you are. Thought you might've skipped town.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Abby, this is Delilah. Delilah, Abby.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: So nice to finally meet you. Abby forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: My, you're even prettier in person.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And this is from a beauty pageant winner.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: So... why are you boxing?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Why not? Girl doesn't have to be one thing, does she?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but, boxing can ruin your looks.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Just like stress, 'n second- hand smoke, 'n my favorite, Father Time. Besides, it's fun. Look! She jabs with her left, a right cross, a left uppercut.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Works the kinks out. C'mon, let me show you. Abby rolls her eyes, mopes over to Delilah.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (demonstrates) Line up your right heel and your left toe. Flex your knees, bend your hips a little, tuck your elbows in, and put up your dukes. Abby caves, she assumes the boxer's stance.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Now jab. Abby jabs with her left.  60.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (joins in) Good. Now try your right. Nate grins as they punch away in harmony.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I've really done it now.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Snap it right out. Good. This is the punch you'll use in case you're ever in a street fight. Or if you just wanna beat up the class clown.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: What about bullies?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Them, too. Nate gazes at Abby. She steals a look back at him. They stop

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Abby, is there something you wanna tell me?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: No. It's not a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What's not a big deal? jabbing. Abby sulks.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: It's just this jerk in my math class. Tommy Willis.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What about Tommy Willis?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: He's been... snapping my bra. I can't get him to stop.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: How long has this been going on?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: A month.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: A month? Why didn't you tell me?  61.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: We all have to fight our own battles. Isn't that what you said?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: This is different.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Because you're my daughter. That's why.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Might I offer a suggestion?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: The combination punch!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Delilah, please... let's be realistic.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Hear me out. Is this boy bigger than you?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's pretty big. And fat.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Don't you worry 'bout that. That's just hormones 'n poor eatin' habits. Come with me. She leads them to a

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Delilah, what are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: What are we doin'? We're puttin' arrows in your daughter's quiver. That's what we're doin'. Three to be exact. And you're gonna be the honorary guinea pig. Is that okay with you, Abby?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Delilah sets Nate in front of her.  62.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Now. Make like you're Tommy Willis.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What do you expect me to do?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Improvise. Nate puffs out his cheeks like he's a hundred pounds overweight. He raises his arms up like a monster, aims fo Delilah's bra. Abby giggles.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Now just watch me, Abby. (demonstrates in slow- motion) Left jab. Then a straight right. Then finish 'im off with a left hook.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Got it. (pulls out a tiny notepad and pen) Left, right, left.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Right. I'm gonna do it a little faster this time, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Okay. Delilah delivers the combination on Nate. She pulls the punches a bit, but truth is, she didn't like the comment about being realistic. Nate falls heavily on his keester. Delilah hovers over Nate menacingly. A WOMAN in a pink sweater approaches.

dialogues.speaker: PINK SWEATER
dialogues.text: Miss MacIntosh?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: PINK SWEATER
dialogues.text: I knew it was you. I'm Sheila Reynolds. I work over at Channel 3. How would you feel about coming on Good Mornin', Savannah tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (duh) You're askin' me if I wanna be on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STUDIO AUDIENCE whips up a frenzy. Talk show host KIP 40s, salt-and-pepper hair with a scary-white smile, sits alongside MINDY, 28, perky brunette with dimples.

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: And we're back. Hello again, everyone, and welcome to Good Mornin', Savannah. Our next guest has taken makeovers to an absolute extreme. She's won two beauty pageants right here in our beloved state of Georgia, including this year's Magnolia Princess. And then what does she go and do? She puts on boxing gloves. I mean, can you believe it? Whaddya say, should we bring her out here?

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: Well alright, then. Everyone, please welcome to our show, the Beauty Queen turned Boxer... Delilah MacIntosh! The Studio Audience goes NUTS. Delilah waves as she strid across the stage, she kisses Kip and Mindy on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: G' Mornin'!

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: And Good Morning to you, Delilah. May I call you Delilah?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Well that's my name, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: (obnoxious laugh) Yes, it sure is. So tell us, Delilah, what on earth happened? Why trunks instead of an evening gown?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: You mean you didn't hear?

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Raise your hand if you heard about me. Nearly everyone raises their hand, including Mindy.  The crowd 64.

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: (gesturing to Mindy) Even she heard. What didn't I hear?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I was stood up at the altar. Boos.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I agree.

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: (more comical than angry) Why don't you tell me these things?!

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I thought I'd leave it up to her to bring it up. I didn't want to say anything to embarrass her.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Thank you for that. You're so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: So now it's all beginning to make sense. Wait a sec. No it isn't. Some jerk jilts you, and you put on boxing gloves? I don't get it. How long ago was this?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Comin' up on five months. Did I mention my ex- is a boxer?

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: No, but... Hold it. Are you saying what I think you're saying?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I'm gonna box his ass blue.

dialogues.speaker: ON TELEVISION
dialogues.text: Delilah on Good Mornin', Savannah.

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: Oh my God! You can't be serious. Is she serious, folks?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Go on, tell im.

dialogues.text: Well, I'll be... you heard it here first. But what about bygones bein' bygones? Don't you believe in that?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Oh please. I was jilted in front o' all my friends, my family, everyone. No self-respectin' belle's gonna stand for such nonsense. (directly into camera) Itn't that right, Kelvin?

dialogues.text: She's flipped her fritters.

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: There sure is. His name's Nate. And he's a doctor. The crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: KIP
dialogues.text: Wow, look at you. So many changes in such a short period of time...

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: And he is the sweetest man I have ever met. So kind, and considerate. The type I used to think belonged only in fairy tales...

Gladys returns fire with a straight right that clears Delilah's sinuses. She adjusts her headgear. A one-two combination from Delilah throttles Gladys, but she's late returning to guard and pays for it in spades. Delilah's rhythm turns haphazard again. Gladys sees that she's off balance and capitalizes with a mean left hook. The BELL. Hank sets down a stool and goes to work applyin Vaseline, Romeo waters down Delilah.

Then, Delilah GROWLS at Gladys. Her opponent steps back. Delilah struts out of her corner like a cat on the prowl. Gladys swings and misses. Another one, misses. Delilah beams with confidence, swaggers as she throws everything but the kitchen sink at her opponent. Gladys tries to shield herself from the barrage. The BELL. Hank and Romeo storm the ring.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: I knew you could do it!

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: (hugs Delilah) She looked just like you. Except older, fatter, and on crack.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (laughs) Thanks. She gets caught up in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH

dialogues.text: (chanting) DELILAH... It finally dawns on Delilah that Tandy's not in the ring. She scans the arena. Her smile wilts when she spots Tandy heading down the aisle toward the showers.

dialogues.text: Mirabelle pours a cup of coffee for a WOMAN seated at the table: 40s, white pantsuit, and a pretentious scarf.

dialogues.speaker: PRETENTIOUS
dialogues.text: Thank you. Smells delightful.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: So is this something that would pay per assignment, or would she receive an annual salary?

dialogues.speaker: PRETENTIOUS
dialogues.text: It's per assignment. But, trust me, it's quite lucrative, just the same. I suppose if I talk to some people --

dialogues.text: I think she might be coming. (nonchalantly) I am so glad I tried this brand of coffee. Isn't it heavenly? Delilah saunters in, ignoring the people seated at the ta She rests the box of cookies on the counter.

dialogues.text: Oh, Delilah. There's someone I'd like you to meet. This is Ms. Williamson. She works for Ciao Belle magazine. Pretentious stands and extends her hand with a flawless s She towers over Delilah.

dialogues.text: I prefer to stand, thank you. What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH

dialogues.text: I didn't raise you to be this disrespectful. Delilah tries for a REPLY, but again it's incomprehensibl

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: Go on, leave. Now! Go box yourself into a corner, why don't you? Delilah delivers an elaborate curtsy and departs with a b queen wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate mixes a protein drink in a blender. Delilah sits at the table, gazing blankly out the window.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Maybe she'll come around.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I dunno. She seemed pretty hurt.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: At least now we won't have to meet in the ER. That's a relief.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I guess. Her brooding comes to an abrupt halt.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Wait. Are you sayin' you feel relieved about all this?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Maybe a little. Delilah cocks her head back like: "I didn't just hear tha

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Okay more than a little.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: How could you say a thing like that? I've invested my whole life in this.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You think it's easy for me, watching people take swings at you?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: No, but, this is my future we're talkin' about.  73.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: If being concerned about you makes me selfish then I'm plumb out of ideas. I'm not in a real hurry to lose someone I care about. A moment of silence. Nate pours the protein drink. On the countertop, he glimpses the Sports section. Headline: "Delilah Buries the Gravedigger!" Nate sets

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I'm just not sure it was all because I didn't tell her about Kelvin. the drink on the table, sits across from Delilah.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: She said: I hope you guys are real happy together. Lord knows she couldn't've have meant him.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Maybe she meant us.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I s'pose.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Do you think she might be --

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I dunno... I don't think so. We waltzed once but we were just practicin' my footwork.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Maybe you were.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Is it gettin' hot in here or is it just me?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No, it's getting hot. Very hot. Smokin' hot, as a matter of fact. C'mon. Delilah follows him out.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Nate collapses on the sofa. Delilah curls up in a ball.  74.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: How's Abby doin'?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Better, actually. She's not disappearing as fast after dinner.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: That's a start. She upstairs studyin'?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Nope. She's got piano, Tuesdays.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Interestin'.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Wanna know something?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I didn't even know she was wearing a bra.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Well maybe she is. But I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah slugs away on SlamMan, sweat flicking off of her. Mirabelle appears in the doorway, carrying a photo album.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: Can I show you something? Delilah stops abruptly, in no mood for Momma's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: I came across it this morning. Thought you might wanna have a look. She sidles up to Delilah, and opens the

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO ALBUM
dialogues.text: Pictures from all of Delilah's beauty pageants.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: Do you remember? We took you to so many...  75.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: How come I haven't seen a lot of these?

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: They're for special occasions. Just like this. So many years, so much energy and hard work, you devoted. I just want to say... how proud I am of you. (off Delilah's perplexed look) I mean it. How many people do we know come up with one goal today, just to forget about it tomorrow? That's why New Year's resolutions are such a joke. And that's why... it pains me to see you slide.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Who's slidin'? I'm not slidin'.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: I never stopped to consider just how traumatic an experience it must've been for you. To be left standing there. That's my fault. I should've known better. It's understandable you'd want an escape route of some kind. And you chose boxing.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Momma. It's not just an escape route.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: Honey, who could blame you for wanting to beat the bejesus out of that boy? I couldn't. It's just awful what he did. But do you really want to throw away everything you worked for?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: This isn't even about me, is it.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: What? Of course it is.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: No it isn't. It's about you. And how you're always lookin' for a return on your investment. Well sometimes it just doesn't happen, Momma! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirabelle She heads 76.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Sometimes a stock tanks and you just gotta take it like a lady! (paces) You know what I think? I think this was about you from the very beginnin'. Ever since I was five. yawns.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: And to see you come in here holdin' your precious photo album, tryin' to forge a Hallmark card outta nothin'... well that's just tacky, Momma.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: (red alert) Don't you ever use that word on me.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I just did! Tacky, tacky, tacky. Want a Tic Tac, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: You know what the real shame is in all this?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I'm sure you're gonna tell me.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: Charlene. That's right, your sister. You remember her? God knows she's been neglected far too long. I'm just gonna have to find a way to make it up to her. (stretches) Lord knows I'm not gonna be around forever. for the door.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: That's exactly how you operate, isn't it, Momma? Ulterior motives and veiled threats. Before you know it, you've got the whole world on a yo- yo. Well, you know what, Momma? Keep your money. I hope it keeps you warm at night. She glides past her mother and out of the room.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelvin throws on a leather jacket over his gaudy shirt an tie. Milling about are Best Man, Buck, Chuck and Tuck.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: You kicked that bitch's ass tonight.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: That's what I do. He adjusts his tie and spits on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Let's blow this Popsicle stand. He leads the way out down a

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: What's next for the K-man?

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: (pumps his fist as he farts) That's what's next. I say we grab ourselves some high-quality snapper.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I had fish two nights ago.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: He means pussy, you dumbass.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Chucky, haven't you gotten laid yet?

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: Hey, maybe we should start a charity.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: The Fuck Chuck Fund. Whaddya think?

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: More like the Upchuck Fund.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: For as little as fifty-two cents a day, you can send Poor Chucky here to a prostitute. The entourage laughs its way through the exit doors.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelvin and the gang are greeted by some flash bulbs. A REPORTER, 30s with super thick hair, approaches with a mi

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Mr. Wingfield, I wonder if I might have a word with you.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Stop wondering and ask away.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Obviously, another victory tonight. Superb performance. But the question that's really on people's minds involves your ex-fiance, Delilah MacIntosh. On Good Mornin', Savannah the other day --

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: (raises his hand like a stop sign) I'm aware of the interview. There won't be any fight. So let me stop you right there. I have too much respect for women to start throwing punches at them, I thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: So there's no chance of that happening.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: You catch on quick.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: You go by the name Sir Kelvin. Now, were you actually knighted by the Queen?

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Is that actually your hair?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Toupee. (flinches) Touch. With all due respect, Mr. Wingfield, it sounds like your ex- means business. Are you aware that she upset Gladys the Gravedigger?  79.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: No, I wasn't aware. But I can't say it surprises me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A suspended television is tuned into Kelvin's interview.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: Kelvin and the Reporter walk and talk.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: So you feel that your ex-fiance does have enough talent to --

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: No, I mean it doesn't surprise me that the judges would squeeze her through.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: But the decision was unanimous.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Look. She's real friendly with people. And she likes to have a good time. I guess it pays to make yourself available that way.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Just a sec. Are you suggesting there was some impropriety on the part of Miss MacIntosh?

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: We're just talking. But let me ask you this... have you ever known a pretty woman to not use looks to her advantage?

dialogues.speaker: RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: Delilah watches the TV, her eyes crimson with rage. She does an about-face and stomps out of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah barges in, surprising a small SALESCLERK, 50s, wi a distinctive white moustache. He drops a box of hangers.

dialogues.speaker: SALESCLERK
dialogues.text: (composes himself) May I help you, madam?  80.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Yes, I need a tuxedo. Size thirty- eight short. Verrrrry SHORT. Salesclerk looks scared. He positions himself behind a ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah stands in the center of her room, drawing on something. She steps back a few paces to get a better loo

dialogues.speaker: SLAMMAN
dialogues.text: Now decked out in a tuxedo and a white bow tie. A pencil moustache, drawn in permanent marker, lines his upper lip Delilah eyes SlamMan with perfect fury. Slowly, she slide on her bag gloves.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: This is gonna hurt you a lot more than it's gonna hurt me. She unleashes hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah slinks in wearing shades. As she pulls them off, she spots Tandy. They exchange injured looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah marches over to the

dialogues.speaker: SINKS
dialogues.text: and sets her gym bag on the counter. She pulls out a brus As Delilah brushes her hair, she spots Slice two sinks ov applying makeup. She wears a pale purple blouse. Slice scowls at Delilah through the reflection.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Must be hard.

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Hatin' someone you don't even know.

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: You mean you?  81.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: I know enough.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Where're you goin' all fancied up?

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: What's it to you?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Just makin' conversation. If you'd rather stand here and grimace at each other, I guess that's fine. (wraps her ponytail) Got a lunch date? Slice looks at Delilah askew. She folds

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: Hank's taking me to that Thai restaurant that opened up.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Oh the one on Hanover? I been meanin' to try that one. By the way, that blush is all wrong for you. (zips up her gym bag)

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: No it ain't.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Course it is. her arms like a professor eager to pontificate.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Makeup one-oh-one. You're either cool, cool, cool or warm, warm, warm.

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: You've got auburn hair. Nice auburn hair, as a matter of fact. That was a compliment, don't let it fluster you. Your colorin' is both warm and intense. So guess what? You want your makeup and clothes to match. Warm, warm, warm. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: That blush is too light for you. Makes you look harsh. And you don't need any help with that. Let me see, I might just have somethin... She unzips her gym bag and dumps a cornucopia of makeup o the counter.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (sifting through it) That one's too light. No, not that one. HERE. This'll work. Autumn. It won't wash you out. Now go on and rinse that stuff off your face. Slice hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Go on, now. You don't wanna go ona date lookin' like Casper the Friendly Ghost, do ya? Slice washes her face.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Here's a towel. (tosses one from her bag) Nothin' I like more than a clean slate. Now, is that the only shirt you got?

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: I usually wear one at a time.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I'll see what I got in the car. She skedaddles. Slice watches her leave. She looks over the abundance of makeup, glimpses herself in the mirror. She's just not accustomed to this level of attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abby walks with her friend, MELISSA. Both carry backpacks

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: I can't believe Mr. Hogan is having us do a paper on snails. I mean, what do you say... they're slow, and slimy, and French people eat them. Case closed.  83.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: At least we don't have to dissect them. That would really suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit the building.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA
dialogues.text: Call me if you're not doing anything later. I'll come over and show you those boots I got.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Later. She veers course, cutting across the playground. The sound of RUNNING footsteps behind her, culminating wi the SNAP of Abby's bra.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Cut the shit, you asshole! TOMMY WILLIS has got about a hundred pounds on Abby, with rosy cheeks. His THREE BUDDIES are skinny and pale.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: (mocking) Cut the shit, you asshole. The Buddies laugh hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: TOMMY
dialogues.text: Why don't you make me? Abby thinks about it. She removes the backpack from her shoulder and drops it casually to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Okay. She raises her sleeves and puts up her dukes. Tommy looks at his Buddies befuddled: you really think I should fight this girl? He turns to face Abby, raises his fists.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDIES
dialogues.text: (chanting) TOMMY... Tommy bends his head forward, pumps his fists. He peeks a Abby through his eyebrows. An evil grin spreads out over his face.  84. They move in a circle. Tommy throws a few weak punches, thinking it will intimidate Abby. It doesn't. He decides to go for the stomach. Mistake. Abby catches Tommy with an UPPERCUT that brings him to an upright posi This sets her up nicely for a ONE-TWO that drops him on h ass. The Buddies double over laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDIES
dialogues.text: (chanting) ABBY...

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: Come on. Get up, Bubbalicious. Tommy is more staggered than he'd like to admit. He can't quite make it to his feet. A final crowd-pleaser: Abby reaches into her shirt and un her bra. The Buddies jump about like they're auditioning for Springer. Abby approaches Tommy from behind and manages to clasp th bra around his enormous torso.

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: You're gonna need a bigger cup size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah, alone in the corner, affixes iron plates toa barbell. By the looks of her, she's been at it all day. She lies down to bench press. Manages to lift the bar up. Squeezes out three reps. She goes for a fourth, brings the weight down to her ches But that's it. She's on empty. Delilah struggles but she can't get the bar off her chest. Deep breath, one more tr

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Motherfuckin' horseshit cocksucker fuckin' piece of shit asshole motherfuckin' shitstain bitch! The Gym-goers are not accustomed to hearing this language from Delilah. They look on in sheer horror as she adds complexity to her litany of profanity. Tandy emerges from her office.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: (to Gym-goers) Are you fuckin' BLIND? She races over and snags the barbell, sets it on the rack  Delilah's 85.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Trying to kill yourself, Goldilocks? too spent to reply. She sits up, gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Should I look outside and see if the moon's blood red?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: I never heard you swear like that.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I save it. Special occasions only.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: I see. How's the hunt for a trainer going?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: It's goin'. No, that's a lie. Tell you the truth, I haven't been lookin'.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I wouldn't wanna put anyone else through the trouble.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: There's only so many people you can let down 'fore you start feelin' ashamed o' yourself. (lies down on bench) A lot easier this way.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me about wanting to fight Kelvin?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I heard what you said to Slice. The day I walked in here. I figured... (fighting herself) It's still no excuse for lyin'.  86.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: What makes you think he would fight you? After all this, he could just say no.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I s'pose he could. Already done it once. Guess I didn't think that far ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Or worse, what if he did fight you and kicked your teeth in? Say Goodbye to Magnolia Princess. And how's that for embarrassing? Getting beat up by the guy who left you at the altar.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Never said it was gonna be easy. But that's how I know it's right.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: You feel like getting outta here for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah and Tandy in a rowboat. Delilah does all the work

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: This was a great idea. Nice to be out for a change.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: (fixes her hair) So how does your boyfriend -- Nathan, is it?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Nate.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: How does he feel about you boxing Kelvin?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: He's very supportive.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Isn't he worried you might get hurt?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I s'pose so. Anything happens, at least he's a doctor.  87.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. The way you two met. You got yourself a story right there. All this time spent trying to hook up at the bar... I shoulda tried the ER.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (chuckles) So uh... do you have a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: No. I don't. An uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: You two have gone out quite some time, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: "Bout five months.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: You think he might be the one?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Sure feels like it.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (mulls it over) Because I don't have to ask. Tandy realizes that's checkmate. She curls her frown of discontent into a smile, for Delilah's sake.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: You know, you're gonna need to attract more attention if you wanna get Kelvin in the ring with you. And for that, you need a gimmick.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: You mean like a silk jacket with my name sewn on the back?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Hell no. Everyone's got that. We need something bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Tandy at her side, Delilah makes her way toward the ring in a RED HOOPSKIRT. The CROWD loves her.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) Delilah glides toward the ring in a GREEN hoopskirt. 2) She electrifies the crowd as she knocks out her OPPONE 3) Another bout, Delilah in an ORANGE hoopskirt. 4) Delilah, Nate and Abby sit on a park bench eating ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: So how'd it go again?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: (miming) Uppercut, jab, straight right.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Good girl. Has he bothered you since?

dialogues.speaker: ABBY
dialogues.text: I'm not sure we still go to the same school. 5) Delilah at her locker. She notices that her engagement ring has been returned, spots Slice sneaking away. 6) Delilah enters Tandy's office. Tandy sits at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Do you keep a Lost 'n Found?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Back here, in a box.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Can you add this to it? She hands her the engagement ring. 7) Romeo sews a YELLOW hoopskirt as Delilah skips rope. 8) Delilah enters the ring in a YELLOW hoopskirt and matc parasol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tandy sits rigidly in a chair, eyes a magazine on a table Behind the desk, a buxom RECEPTIONIST, 20s, without a bra

dialogues.speaker: BRALESS
dialogues.text: Miss Burrows, Mr. Naddle will see you now.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tandy enters.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Mr. Naddle. MR. NADDLE, 40s, is a Slippery fucker - no really, he is his pomade starts just above his eyebrows and ends somewh around the back of his collar. His smile reveals an assortment of unhealthy colors. His suit is circa Seventi

dialogues.speaker: MR. NADDLE
dialogues.text: Ms. Burrows. What brings you here? He leans back in his swivel chair and props up his feet. Wouldn't you know, he's wearing beach sandals. Eight toes and only seven of them are equipped with an ingrown nail.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: (looking away) My client would like to formally challenge your fighter, Mr. Wingfield, to a three-round bout. She turns to look him in the eye, but his grin snaps her back into shape.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NADDLE
dialogues.text: I'd be happy to run the idea past him... Tandy gives in to temptation again. She catches an eyeful of Mr. Naddle slipping his hand down the front of his pan

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: (jerks away) God.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NADDLE
dialogues.text: Is something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: No. I just... She looks up, in time to see him sniff his excavating han

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: (trying not to heave) You can let me know. I don't want to be late for my pap smear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah sips a mint julep in a corner booth. Tandy arrive  90.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. Had a fight with my landlord.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: That's okay.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Whatcha drinking there?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Mint julep. Want one?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: No thanks. (to WAITRESS) Sam Adams, please. And another julep for her.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Don't mention it.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (eager for info) So?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Oh right. I guess one of the tenants complained that I was blasting k.d. lang all day. And I'm like, Grits- for-Brains, I'm at the gym all day. So it couldn't be me. Besides, I don't even like k.d. lang. So what does this asshole do? He starts searching my apartment for k.d. lang. Tossing pillows, moving furniture. I felt like Tim Robbins in that -- what was that prison picture?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Shawshank Redemption.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Right. Can you fuckin' believe that movie didn't win a single Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: No, I meant, what'd you find out? Did you hear back from his manager? Tandy turns solemn. The dog and pony show's over.  91.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Sweetie. He said No. The bottom falls out from under Delilah.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Probably cuz he's scared. But I'm sure he'll tell his society friends something different.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: That's awful. You mean all this was just...

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: I can see how it feels that way. But look at you, you're in the best shape of your life. You started something that six months ago you probably thought you'd never do. You met some new people...

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I know but...

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Should count for something.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: It does but... I'm not sure where I'm at if the fight doesn't happen.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: You're in a bar. Having a drink. With me. She props her elbows on the table, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (stirs her drink) Can I ask you somethin'? Tandy tilts her head.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: What do you do when it feels like you're just out there, twistin' in the wind?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: I pretend like I'm flying.  92. Delilah's eyes drift to a burn mark on the inside of Tand forearm.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: What happened there? Tandy brings her arms down to her lap.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: It's nothing. Just my ex-. He could be pretty creative sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah finds comfort on Nate's shoulder. They watch a gr black and white film.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You can always go back to beauty pageants, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Think I'm done tryin' to look the part of someone perfect. Smiled so darn much, it hurts when I don't.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Doesn't have to be a bad thing.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: This might've been the first thing I ever wanted, that I'm sure came from me. My mother had nothin' to do with it. (beat) Wanna hear somethin' funny?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Definitely not.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Kelvin 'n Marney are gettin' married this Saturday. Saw it in the paper.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Funny pages?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Naturally.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We weren't invited?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Course we were invited. We'll be sharin' a table with three porn stars and the Easter Bunny.  93.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Festive. They share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: God, we have really gone off our pecan, haven't we?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Seriously though, they should have invited you.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Are you out o' your cotton ball pickin' mind?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You sort of brought those two lowlifes together, didn't you? Delilah makes like she's gonna punch Nate in the arm, the

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (light bulb) You're right. I did bring those two lowlifes together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large group of FOLKS. At the head table, Kelvin and Marne smooch. Best Man steps up to the mike.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: Hello, everyone. Good night. Er um, I mean, Good evening. Shoot. I already screwed up. Kelvin shares a chuckle with the Folks.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: Just wanna say... how proud I am to be Kelvin's best man. I can still remember the first time I met Marney. Marney's fake smile shrivels a tad.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: She just had... so much energy. You know? Tons and tons of spunk. Inside of her. And um, I just think the decision is umaninous. I mean, umaminous. No wait. Unaminous. Sorry. U-nan-i-mous. A few mock cheers.  94.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: They're just made for each other. The Folks applaud. A lean FIGURE ambles toward the mike. She wears a bonnet and funky fuchsia shades.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Good evenin'. How y'all doin'? The disguise comes off.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Get down! She's got a bomb! In a loud, ugly rumble the Folks hit the deck.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. I don't have a bomb. Or did you just say, she's the bomb? She laughs, the Folks make their way back up to their cha

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Honestly, you should move to Hollywood with an imagination like that. Kelvin and Marney, so nice to see you... (waves ) I'm sorry to startle you nice folks. I don't make a habit of crashin' weddings. But I needed a large group of understandin' people, and naturally this is the first place I thought of. I'd like all y'all to meet my boyfriend, Doctor Nate More. Nate offers a brief wave from the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Doctor More works over at County Hospital. And for those of you who don't know, the hospital's in need of more space. But they lack the necessary funds. Some o' the patients there wind up gettin' treated in the hallway. It's happened to me. Raise your hand if this's happened to you. The Folks look at each other bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Go on, don't be shy. Some of the older Folks raise their hands.  95.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: See, Nate 'n I didn't care for that. So we went ahead and started up a charity drive. It's called Room to Grow. Now why am I tellin' you nice folks this? Well, I'd like to take this opportunity to invite Mr. Wingfield here to join me in the ring. Kelvin smirks at his constituency, wags his finger at Del

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: All proceeds from the bout would go toward expandin' the hospital. 'Fore you know it, y'all won't have to leave your flowers out in the hall when you go visit Grandma after she falls 'n breaks her hip. Or when Grandpa throws out his back. Wouldn't that be nice? Nods and murmurs of agreement.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I can't speak for Kelvin, but I find boxin' to be empowerin', ya know? It's changed my life entirely. And I just think if there's a way of improvin' someone else's life, by golly I'm gonna do it. Amazin' what throwin' a few punches can do. Wanna try it with me? She throws a slow series of left and right jabs, alternat

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Come on now. It's just me. Some of the Folks begin to jab. One "misfire" and Best Ma falls flat on his back.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Itn't it fun? Everybody! You, too, bridegroom. (chants) KELVIN... KELVIN... KELVIN... The number of Folks jabbing, and chanting, grows and grow Until the only ones left silent are Kelvin and Marney. Delilah grins from ear to ear as she punches away. She mo to her ex: "See you in the ring."  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelvin broods over the society pages. A topless Marney pl down in a chair, holding a small gift. Bites into her toa

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Whatcha got there?

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: Delilah's present. Handed it toa bridesmaid on her way out.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: She's a clever one, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: Always was. Ever since we were kids. Any idea when the fight would happen?

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: They're supposed to get in touch with Nads tomorrow. If she wants the fight so bad, then who am I to stop her?

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: (unwrapping gift) Think it's poisonous?

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Point that thing away from me. It's probably radioactive. Marney opens the box.

dialogues.speaker: A NALONI BUCINTORO WATCH
dialogues.text: shines bright from inside. Marney quickly shuts the box. She looks down at herself like it just dawned on her that she's half naked. Rushes out of the room with box in hand

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: So... what'd she get us?

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nothing special. I'm gonna go get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah and Samuel eat breakfast at the table. Mirabelle washes dishes.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: So how would it happen?  Mirabelle Really? Mirabelle She leaps 97.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Well, it wouldn't be sanctioned, so I guess we'd have to raise the money ourselves to rent out a club. chortles her disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: I can think of at least two places that would give you a good rate.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: People should know when they're making total fools of themselves.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Daddy. I appreciate you doin' that.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: My pleasure, Honeybee.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: You're unbelievable, you two. I think you may have retired a bit too early, Samuel. You have far too much time on your hands.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: You know what? I think I might have a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: Why not have it here?

dialogues.speaker: ABSOLUTELY NOT.
dialogues.text: turns the water off.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: Why not? I think we have the space, we could rent another tent.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: That would be fantastic, Daddy! up and kisses her father on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: MIRABELLE
dialogues.text: You can ignore me all you want. But there will be NO boxing match at this house. Is that understood? I won't stand for it.  98.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: No. You will stand for it. This is our house. And this is something our daughter wants. If you don't want to be part of it, that's your prerogative. And your loss. Mirabelle SMASHES the dishes in the sink and scampers awa

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Was that a rebuttal?

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: I don't know. The conversation sort of tailed off when she ran away. They look at each other askew... then burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah batters a speed bag senseless.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Kiss My GRITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1) Delilah whales on a heavy bag that Hank holds. 2) She spars with Romeo who fears for his life. 3) Slice applies makeup in the mirror. Behind her, Delila nods her head approvingly. 4) Delilah does incline presses. Tandy spots her.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Bring it home, Goldilocks!

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (straining) You said you weren't gonna call me that. 5) She skips rope in the gym parking lot. 6) Delilah practices slips using the weighted rope.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Is our show on tonight?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: It's a repeat.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Those bastards!  99. 7) With MUSIC playing, she waltzes with Tandy in the ring Slice waltzes with Hank outside the ring. 8) Delilah thrashes SlamMan, still in his tux. 9) She jogs through the streets of Savannah, passes Vendo selling vegetables. Delilah swipes a peach. She turns, throws up a Hail Mary. The peach hits the Vend in the chest, all over his white shirt. He's tickled pink 10) Delilah's jog continues. She tails away from the crow from the noise, from just about everything, chasing a sun

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD, (IN RED)
dialogues.text: The BELL tolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelvin, in red trunks, shadowboxes in front of the mirror Buck, Chuck, Tuck and the Best Man, all dressed up, toss around a Nerf football.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: Never thought I'd see the inside of this place again.

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Yo Kel, you're battin' a thousand in this room, eh?

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Damn straight. (blows snot on floor) A knock. Kelvin motions to Chuck, he answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: (stage whisper) It's Mitzi. Kelvin searches the few files in his brain: Mitzi... Mitz He turns to the mirror and combs his weeny moustache.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Okay, let her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delilah stands in her bathrobe before the full-length mir Tandy and Charlene wrap her hands.  100.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Am I doing it right?

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: You're doing great.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Have you been workin' out?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Yup. Started on the treadmill. Lost seven pounds.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Good for you, it shows.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Thanks. Tandy smiles at Charlene, turns to Delilah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marney climbs out of her black Beamer. TWO PAPARAZZI appe

dialogues.speaker: PAPARAZZO ONE
dialogues.text: There she is. Homewrecker extraordinaire. Smile for us, Babe. (snaps picture)

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: PAPARAZZO TWO
dialogues.text: Surprised she'd show her face here.

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: It's for charity, Jerk-offs. Flash bulbs light up the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marney glides along with a scowl, turns a corner and spot

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN
dialogues.text: running in the opposite direction. Vanishes around a corn Marney places her hand on the doorknob to the Guest Room, and the door bursts open. Kelvin and his entourage high- five each other as they exit. They walk right by Marney.

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: Hellooo. I need to talk to you.  101.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Hellooo. Boxing. (punches the air) Ring a bell? Marney stands with her mouth agape as they strut away.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Does this mean I'm not a virgin no more?

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: No way, dude. That's cheatin'.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Why is that cheating?

dialogues.speaker: BUCK
dialogues.text: Cuz it is, pencildick.

dialogues.speaker: TUCK
dialogues.text: But we'll give you an E for effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balloons, streamers, confetti. It could pass for a weddin Kelvin and his gang make their way down the aisle. A sold out crowd of FANS greet them with RASPBERRIES and CATCALL Mr. Naddle joins the procession, clad in a leopard-skin s He smiles at the unruly Fans, scaring some of the childre

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Nate and Abby nosh on fried dough. Abby wears a pretty dr and it looks like Nate has gotten himself a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: RINGSIDE
dialogues.text: A TALL WOMAN in black sits next to Marney. Her smile reve a snaggletooth. Marney flinches, looks down at her new wa

dialogues.speaker: SNAGGLETOOTH
dialogues.text: My, that's purty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelvin bounces up and down in his silk jacket, loosening The Minister, now dressed in a tux, straightens his bow t

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER
dialogues.text: (into mike) Dearly Beloved... Good evening, and WELCOME... to the ENGAGEMENT OF ENRAGEMENT. The Fans HOOT and CHEER.  102.

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER
dialogues.text: In this corner, wearing red trunks, weighing in at one hundred and twelve noble pounds... SIR KELVIN WINGFIELD. BooS fill the tent. Kelvin's clan disses the Fans. Mr. Naddle finds solace in his pants. The lights suddenly go out. A spotlight appears at the

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO THE AISLE
dialogues.text: The brass Quintet plays the opening bars of Mendelssohn's WEDDING MARCH. Stepping forward into the light are...

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH AND SAMUEL
dialogues.text: Samuel in a tuxedo, and Delilah in a WEDDING DRESS and VE

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RING
dialogues.text: Kelvin's EYES widen in terror. The bride and her father walk proudly, smiling at each ot Team Delilah follows: Charlene, Tandy, Slice, Hank, Romeo and the Flower Girl, scattering magnolia petals.

dialogues.speaker: MINISTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, weighing in at one hundred and eight pounds... The Jabbing Julep... The Bride who Cried... The Belle From Hell... DELILAH MACINTOSH. The crowd ERUPTS. Team Delilah takes the

dialogues.speaker: RING
dialogues.text: by storm. Jumping, hopping, dancing, whatever you like. Delilah meets Kelvin in the center of the ring for the

dialogues.speaker: STARE DOWN
dialogues.text: Delilah pushes her veil out of the way, stares through Ke

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: I'll go easy on you, don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Don't make promises you can't keep.  103. Kelvin does his best to hide his fear.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH'S CORNER
dialogues.text: Tandy takes delight in tearing off Delilah's dress.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: That's as close as I came to a honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN'S CORNER
dialogues.text: Kelvin puts in his mouth guard.

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: Watch out, Kel. Here Comes the -- BELL. Delilah charges at Kelvin, THROTTLES him with a rig

dialogues.speaker: BEST MAN
dialogues.text: Bride. Delilah unleashes a flurry of jabs that backs Kelvin into corner. He covers up. Kelvin then surprises her with a right uppercut.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: You like that? I was savin' it. Delilah drops back to the center of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: I'm glad we have this time to catch up. Get ready to be whooped, Honeybunch. He lands a double jab.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I'd throw a low blow, but that wouldn't do any good. She throws a body shot, but he parries it. Kelvin counter with a one-two that stuns her.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: By the time I'm done with you, you won't be able to model for Fangoria. He delivers a triple jab.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I bet you say that to all the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Keep your cool, Delilah!  104. Kelvin slips her left hook and counters with a right cros Kelvin rains down punches. Delilah's saved by the BELL.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH'S CORNER
dialogues.text: Hank sets down a stool. Romeo and Slice tend to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: What's all this talking? This ain't therapy. Keep your guard up and your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: SLICE
dialogues.text: Don't waste any o' your energy talking to that scumbag.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: This guy takes it in the ass, Delilah. Believe me. They all turn to look at Romeo.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN'S CORNER
dialogues.text: Mr. Naddle rubs Vaseline under Kelvin's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MR. NADDLE
dialogues.text: You don't owe this girl nothing. Take her out in the second so we can all get hummers and go home. The BELL. Delilah walks straight into a combination by Kelvin. She counters with a body shot that makes him laugh.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: You never could go down, could you. Delilah throws a triple jab but he slips all of them easi A straight right opens Delilah's left eye.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Ohpp. Somebody got a booboo. Delilah downshifts to her box step, throwing up weak jabs

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Are we dancing now? Is that what we're doing? An uppercut throws her off balance and out of rhythm. Del sneaks a peek at Tandy who for the first time looks worri  105. She turns back and Kelvin drops her with a right cross!

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH'S HEAD SWIMS
dialogues.text: As the Referee counts, a FLASHBACK of Delilah winning her first beauty pageant. Mirabelle sneers from the audience. Delilah struggles to her feet at the count of seven. Kelvin charges, right into a juicy LOW BLOw.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: Nothing below the belt.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (smirks) I agree. The BELL. Kelvin worms back to his corner.

dialogues.speaker: RINGSIDE
dialogues.text: Charlene spies Mirabelle peeking from Delilah's bedroom window. Mirabelle backs out of view, tripping over SlamMa Meanwhile, Snaggletooth sucks on a cigar. She blows a smo ring toward Kelvin.

dialogues.speaker: SNAGGLETOOTH
dialogues.text: Man, his butt sure dudn't quit, does it? Some thangs never change...

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: SNAGGLETOOTH
dialogues.text: You could say that. Him AND that cast of characters he hangs around with. Not a single one of em knows how to satisfy a woman, but together they sure do make music.

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SNAGGLETOOTH
dialogues.text: I like to think of it as group therapy. Now -- Kelvin -- he's the smallest one o' the bunch. She uses her cigar as a visual aid.  106.

dialogues.speaker: SNAGGLETOOTH
dialogues.text: But let me tell ya... that boy... he can really shoot. (wipes her mouth) Marney pulls back in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: MARNEY
dialogues.text: How long ago was this?

dialogues.speaker: SNAGGLETOOTH
dialogues.text: (eyes Marney's watch) I dunno, what time you got?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH'S CORNER
dialogues.text: Blood trickles from her eye. Slice presses down on it.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: This guy humiliated you in front of everyone. You remember? Now's your chance to make it right.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I thought you said boxin' wasn't about anger.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: Who said anything about getting angry? The BELL. They meet in the center of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: Touch gloves and fight.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: I ain't touchin' him. He's probably been with ev'ry woman here. And Marney, too. Kelvin grins. They stand toe-to-toe, eyeing each other.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: I have a confession to make. (jabs)

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Erectile dysfunction is highly treatable these days. (jabs)

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Marney and I fucked on our wedding day. (left hook)  107.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Well lollipops to you. Did you do her in the reception hall or in the rectory? (right cross)

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: No I mean we fucked on OUR wedding day. While he's busy gesticulating "me and you", Delilah depos a straight right, right in the KISSER.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Hold on now. A FLASHBACK of Delilah swinging and missing on her weddin day. BACK TO PRESENT. Same punch. She CONNECTS.

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Honeybunch. Another FLASHBACK of another miss. BACK TO PRESENT. She ROCKS his world.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Still think you're gonna whoop me?

dialogues.speaker: KELVIN
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Now was that so hard to say? She unloads a LEFT HOOK that spins her ex-fianc like a t Down to the mat! The Fans GO NUTS!

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (standing over him) Capeesh?! A Trumpeter plays TAPS as the Referee counts down Kelvin. He's OUT! Team Delilah rushes the ring. Charlene places a pageant tiara atop her sister's head.  108.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: No sense having it collect dust. They hug. Samuel ruffles Delilah's hair.

dialogues.speaker: SAMUEL
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Daddy. You, too. Meanwhile, Hank and Romeo stir the Fans into a frenzy, chanting: DELILAH, DELILAH... Even Slice joins in. Delilah turns and Tandy KISSES her full on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: TANDY
dialogues.text: I mean... Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: DELILAH
dialogues.text: (blushes) Thanks! As she waves to the crowd, Nate and Abby enter the ring. Nate taps the Minister on the shoulder. Kelvin begins to snap out of it, just in time to see Nate get down on one knee in the center of the ring with mike hand. The crowd goes APESHIT. It dawns on Delilah to turn around and see what all the h is about. Her eyes POP.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Miss Delilah, will you marry me? (brandishes the ring)

dialogues.speaker: "DEED I WILL.
dialogues.text: Nate slides the engagement ring onto her

dialogues.speaker: FINGER
dialogues.text: It covers the mark left by the old one. She beams. They kiss. Confetti fills the air surrounding them.
